result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel James Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court waived court costs due to defendant being indigent. 
*Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 2-17-2018 that can not be waived.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
*With 2 days credit. Sentence to commence on 2-24-2017.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel James Olson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel James Olson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements made by state, defense, and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 7 days in the House of Correction, with 2 days credit. Sentence to commence on 2-24-2017.

Court waived court costs due to defendant being indigent. 
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 2-17-2018 that can not be waived.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Sentencing Referral Form.

Defendant Daniel James Olson in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BR. 19 FOR BR. 28.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.
Sentencing to be conducted by Br. 28.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel James Olson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 28.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel James Olson in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel James Olson in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Daniel James Olson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Defense moves to amend case number in paragraph 4.  State concurs.  Court orders case number amended to 95CF448.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel James Olson
Current: 2419A W Greenfield Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 10-31-2016)
Prior: 2108 South 25th Street, #3, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
